title: Google\Cloud\Compute\V1\FirewallPolicy
name: FirewallPolicy
description:
Represents a Firewall Policy resource.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.compute.v1.FirewallPolicy

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.associations
params.description: A list of associations that belong to this firewall policy.

params.name: data.creation_timestamp
params.description: [Output Only] Creation timestamp in RFC3339 text format.

params.name: data.description
params.description: An optional description of this resource. Provide this property when you create the resource.

params.name: data.display_name
params.description: Deprecated, please use short name instead. User-provided name of the Organization firewall policy. The name should be unique in the organization in which the firewall policy is created. This field is not applicable to network firewall policies. This name must be set on creation and cannot be changed. The name must be 1-63 characters long, and comply with RFC1035. Specifically, the name must be 1-63 characters long and match the regular expression [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])? which means the first character must be a lowercase letter, and all following characters must be a dash, lowercase letter, or digit, except the last character, which cannot be a dash.

params.name: data.fingerprint
params.description: Specifies a fingerprint for this resource, which is essentially a hash of the metadata's contents and used for optimistic locking. The fingerprint is initially generated by Compute Engine and changes after every request to modify or update metadata. You must always provide an up-to-date fingerprint hash in order to update or change metadata, otherwise the request will fail with error 412 conditionNotMet. To see the latest fingerprint, make get() request to the firewall policy.

params.name: data.id
params.description: [Output Only] The unique identifier for the resource. This identifier is defined by the server.

params.name: data.kind
params.description: [Output only] Type of the resource. Always compute#firewallPolicyfor firewall policies

params.name: data.name
params.description: Name of the resource. For Organization Firewall Policies it's a [Output Only] numeric ID allocated by GCP which uniquely identifies the Organization Firewall Policy.

params.name: data.parent
params.description: [Output Only] The parent of the firewall policy. This field is not applicable to network firewall policies.

params.name: data.region
params.description: [Output Only] URL of the region where the regional firewall policy resides. This field is not applicable to global firewall policies. You must specify this field as part of the HTTP request URL. It is not settable as a field in the request body.

params.name: data.rule_tuple_count
params.description: [Output Only] Total count of all firewall policy rule tuples. A firewall policy can not exceed a set number of tuples.

params.name: data.rules
params.description: A list of rules that belong to this policy. There must always be a default rule (rule with priority 2147483647 and match "*"). If no rules are provided when creating a firewall policy, a default rule with action "allow" will be added.

params.name: data.self_link
params.description: [Output Only] Server-defined URL for the resource.

params.name: data.self_link_with_id
params.description: [Output Only] Server-defined URL for this resource with the resource id.

params.name: data.short_name
params.description: User-provided name of the Organization firewall policy. The name should be unique in the organization in which the firewall policy is created. This field is not applicable to network firewall policies. This name must be set on creation and cannot be changed. The name must be 1-63 characters long, and comply with RFC1035. Specifically, the name must be 1-63 characters long and match the regular expression [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])? which means the first character must be a lowercase letter, and all following characters must be a dash, lowercase letter, or digit, except the last character, which cannot be a dash.

methods.name: getShortName
methods.description:
User-provided name of the Organization firewall policy. The name should be unique in the organization in which the firewall policy is created. This field is not applicable to network firewall policies. This name must be set on creation and cannot be changed. The name must be 1-63 characters long, and comply with RFC1035. Specifically, the name must be 1-63 characters long and match the regular expression [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])? which means the first character must be a lowercase letter, and all following characters must be a dash, lowercase letter, or digit, except the last character, which cannot be a dash.
